intro: Siphocampylus cuspidatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf thistle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and woolly, aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and features spiny, lobed leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters that bloom in late summer. Siphocampylus cuspidatus is often found in open areas such as meadows and sagebrush steppe.
